title: Our Donors | Singapore Institute of Technology
text_lines: Community Leadership And Social Innovation Centre
Centre for Infrastructure and Tunnel Engineering
Rapid Product Innovation and Development Centre
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee
The Gift that Keeps on Giving

Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee
The Gift that Keeps on Giving
Our deepest appreciation to our donors for their generous support of SIT's students and mission.
Amazon Web Services Singapore Pte Ltd
Bureau Veritas Marine Singapore Pte Ltd
Canon Medical Systems Asia Pte. Ltd.
CLA Global TS Holdings Pte Ltd
IES-IStructE Joint Committee, The Institution of Engineers, Singapore
Info-Communications Media Development Authority of Singapore (IMDA)
ISACA (previously the Information Systems Audit and Control Association)
Kwek Leng Beng and City Developments Limited (CDL)
Rotary Club of Bugis Junction, Singapore
Rotary Club of Jurong Town, Singapore
The Estate of Chong Yook Yin

. Alteryx provides the leading Analytics Automation Platform, delivering easy end-to-end automation of data engineering, analytics, reporting, machine learning, and data science processes, enabling enterprises everywhere to democratize data analytics across their organisations for a broad range of use cases.
Amazon Web Services Singapore Private Limited
Amazon Web Services Book Prize in Distributed Systems Programming
Amazon Web Services Singapore Private Limited
, part of the Amazon Web Services (AWS) global infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of organisations in 190 countries around the world.
(in Change Management and Security Governance, Risk Management and Compliance) are made possible by

. AsiaCloud provides Managed Services to Small and Medium Enterprises in both Singapore and Malaysia markets. With their vCIO Managed Services framework, AsiaCloud help SME secure their emails, devices, and disaster recovery. vCIO connect SME business strategies and technology, enhance their IT security and bring their vision to reality.
Association of Consulting Engineers Singapore Book Prizes
(in Civil Engineering Practices, Electrical Machines and Generators, and Professional Engineering Practices) are made possible by

. ACES is a non-profit association that sets and maintains standards of professional ethics, public accountability and independence amongst its members. ACES represents the independent consulting engineering profession in Singapore and ensures that professional consulting engineers in Singapore are adequately and fairly rewarded for their services.
Baker Tilly Outstanding Student Award in Accountancy
, one of the 10 largest accountancy and business advisory firms in Singapore.

Baker Tilly has been voted among the Top 10 Most Desired Employers for Accountancy and Financial Management, based on a survey of 11,596 local graduates by gradsingapore in 2023 - a testament to the firm's position as a leading employer of choice.

The firm is part of the Baker Tilly International network, spanning across 145 territories, with over 41,000 professionals committed to delivering unparalleled assurance, tax, and advisory services across diverse industry sectors.
Blu5 Group Book Prizes (in Data Analytics and Machine Learning)

. Blu5 takes pride in supporting digitalisation teams with SElink™ Zero Trust Networking to overcome constant but pressing challenges in Connectivity, Networking & Security ranging from workstations, machines, controllers and even down to minuscule sensor level.  SElink™ brings invaluable but measurable benefits to various verticals for easy remote access yet, air-gapping Critical Infrastructures & Resources (i.e. IIoT, OT, Industrial Automation, FinTech, BioMedical, Space & Defence and more) against internal and external cyber threats. Since its foundation in 2007 and with over 40+ patents, the Blu5 R&D team continues to evolve in generating innovative solutions.
Bureau Veritas Marine Singapore Pte Ltd

Bureau Veritas Marine Singapore Good Progress Awards in Naval Architecture and Marine Engineering (Marine Engineering Specialisation, Naval Architecture Specialisation, Offshore Engineering Specialisation)
Marine Singapore Outstanding Student Award Naval Architecture and Marine Engineering
are made possible with a gift from
Bureau Veritas Marine Singapore Pte Ltd

, a prominent classification society (class survey of ships and industrial inspection of naval and non-naval materials). Established in 1973, the company has grown from a small team of marine surveyors to a diverse workforce. Bureau Veritas Marine & Offshore Singapore offers a wide range of services across the marine and offshore industries.
Canon Medical Systems Asia Pte. Ltd
Canon Medical Systems Asia Outstanding Student Award in Diagnostic Radiography
Canon Medical Systems Asia Pte. Ltd
. Canon Medical offers a full range of diagnostic medical imaging solutions including CT, MR, X-Ray, Ultrasound and Healthcare IT across the globe.
CSIT Book Prize in Secured Software Development and CSIT Outstanding Student Award in Information and Communications Technology (Software Engineering)

, a technical agency in the Ministry of Defence that harnesses cutting-edge digital technologies to meet Singapore’s security needs. CSIT’s technical focus includes Cybersecurity, Data Analytics, Software Engineering, and Cloud Infrastructure and Services.

CSIT analyses data to discover potential threats, conduct technical investigations, develop new capabilities and provide threat intelligence to support national security missions such as Cyber Defence, Counter-Terrorism, and Counter Hostile Information Operations.
Changi Airport Group Book Prize in Airport Operations and Management
, whose mission is to be the world's leading airport company, growing a vibrant air hub in Singapore and enhance the communities it serves worldwide.
Choo Chiau Beng Outstanding Student Award in Naval Architecture
, who wishes to empower talented and deserving undergraduates to make most of a quality education at SIT.
CLA Global TS Public Accounting Corporation Book Prize in Auditing

, an established name in the Singapore accounting industry. CLA Global TS is one of the first local accounting firms to be accredited by the Institute of Chartered Accountants in Australia, Institute of Chartered Accountants in England & Wales and Singapore Accountancy Commission - Singapore Qualification Programmes (Singapore QP), to provide the supervision of professionals undergoing traineeship to qualify as Chartered Accountants.
Continental Automotive Singapore Book Prize in Car Interconnects and Vehicular Networks
, one of Continental’s largest R&D centres in Asia dedicated to the development of innovative, intelligent and connected mobility solutions.
Core Concepts Book Prize in Musculoskeletal Physiotherapy (Spine and Ergonomics) or Musculoskeletal Physiotherapy 4

, the largest private physiotherapy group in Singapore operating eight clinics across the island with a team of specialist physiotherapists, occupational therapists, sports massage therapists and sports trainers.
(in Transfer Pricing, and Fraud, Ethics and Forensic Accounting) is made possible by

, one of the largest professional accounting bodies in the world, with more than 172,000 members in over 100 countries and regions, including more than 8,600 members in Singapore. CPA Australia has been operating in Singapore since 1954 and opened the Singapore office in 1989. Core services include education, training, technical support and advocacy. CPA Australia provides thought leadership on local, national and international issues affecting the accounting profession and public interest. They engage with governments, regulators and industries to advocate policies that stimulate sustainable economic growth and have positive business and public outcomes. Find out more at

CSA Book Prizes (in Secure Software Development and in Security Analytics), CSA Top GPA Award in Information and Communications Technology (Information Security) and CSA Yearly Performance Award in Information and Communications Technology (Information Security)

. Established in 2015, CSA seeks to keep Singapore's cyberspace safe and secure to underpin the National Security, power a Digital Economy and protect the Digital Way of Life. CSA is part of the Prime Minister's Office and is managed by the Ministry of Digital Development and Information.
(in Network Security, and Nutrition, Health and Disease) are made possible by
, a web technology and solution provider that aims to help small and midsize companies to quickly implement IT and ecommerce solutions effectively and professionally.
Cyclect Book Prize in Electrical Systems

. Cyclect started operations in 1943 and provides engineering, construction, project management and maintenance solutions for the marine, industrial, built environment and renewable energy sectors. Its solutions have helped numerous clients achieve sustainability and increased competitiveness. With offices in nine countries and employing more than 600 staff, Cyclect has become a trusted partner to many global companies.
Dell Book Prize in Cloud and Distributed Computing and the Dell Yearly Performance Award

. Dell is among the world’s leading technology companies helping to transform people’s lives, from hybrid cloud solutions to high-performance computing to ambitious social impact and sustainability initiatives.
(in Advanced Taxation, Data Analytics and Visualisation, and Financial Accounting) are made possible by

, which is part of the global Deloitte network of member firms with approximately 420,000 people in over 150 countries providing audit and assurance, consulting, financial advisory, risk advisory, tax & legal, and related services.
(in Digital Innovations for Integrated Media, and Web Systems and Technologies) are made possible by
, one of the leading IT talent acquisition and outsourcing companies in Singapore with innovative IT solutions and IT talent outsourcing services.
EY Outstanding Student Award in IWSP

in Singapore. EY is a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services. The insights and quality services EY delivers help build trust and confidence in the capital markets and in economies the world over. EY develops outstanding leaders who team to deliver on its promises to all of its stakeholders. In so doing, it plays a critical role in building a better working world for its people, for its clients and for its communities.
Foo Kon Tan Book Prize in Corporate Reporting and Financial Analysis

, one of Singapore’s most established and respected accountancy practices. Founded in 1968, the firm provides holistic one-stop business and advisory solutions to discerning clients, encompassing a full range of assurance, tax and advisory services to help clients navigate the ever-changing dynamics of the business and regulatory environments in the domestic as well as global markets.
GovTech Award for the Top First Year Student in Information and Communications Technology (Information Security)

. GovTech is the lead agency driving Singapore’s Smart Nation initiatives and public or sector digital transformation. As the Centre of Excellence for Infocomm Technology and Smart Systems (ICT & SS), GovTech develops the Singapore Government’s capabilities in Data Science & Artificial Intelligence, Application Development, Cybersecurity, Digital Infrastructure, and Smart City Technology.
(in Civil Engineering Materials, and Design of Steel and Concrete Structures) are made possible by

, an established stockist with over 40 years of history, providing a wide range of steel products to meet the needs of customers from a wide range of industries, from shipyards to engineering firms and construction companies.
Hummingbird Health Pte Ltd Book Prize in Clinical Radiography Practice 1
has been made possible with a gift from

, a vibrant start-up which has set out to disrupt the radiology practice in Asia. Its shared values of innovation and continuous improvement influence the work done by the practice to make a positive impact on society.

which has over 29,000 members in 138 countries. The international institution is the world’s largest membership organisation dedicated to structural engineering, with sustainability at its heart and advocate for climate action; while continuing to be a global benchmark of competence and technical excellence for structural engineers.
Info-Communications Media Development Authority of Singapore
are made possible with support from the

. IMDA develops and regulates the infocomm and media sectors to create a dynamic, holistic and exciting ecosystem filled with growth opportunities through talent, research, innovation and enterprise. As Architects of Singapore’s Digital Future, IMDA strives to ensure businesses, the workforce and the public are ready for a future enabled by infocomm and digital media.
Institute of Materials (East Asia) Book Prize

, an affiliate of the Institute of Materials, Minerals and Mining, UK. Institute of Materials (East Asia) is a professional institution with the mission to promote knowledge of materials science and engineering. It devotes itself to organising professional activities, assists and co-ordinates various research activities and provides experts’ service to the materials industry.
ISCA Book Prize in Integrative Business Management

, the national accountancy body of Singapore with over 36,000 members in Singapore and around the world. Established in 1963, ISCA is an advocate of the interests of the profession, and administers the Singapore Chartered Accountant Qualification (SCAQ) programme. It is also the Designated Entity to confer the Chartered Accountant of Singapore – CA (Singapore) – designation. ISCA is a member of Chartered Accountants Worldwide, a global family that brings together the members of leading institutes to create a community of over 1.8 million Chartered Accountants and students in more than 190 countries.
ISACA Book Prize in Mobile Security

(previously the Information Systems Audit and Control Association). As a globally recognized leader in IS/IT for over 50 years, ISACA is a professional membership organisation committed to the advancement of digital trust by empowering IS/IT professionals to grow their skills and knowledge in audit, cybersecurity, emerging tech and more.
ITSEC Asia Book Prize in Ethical Hacking

. ITSEC is one of the leading information security consulting firms in Asia, and has served and empowered businesses since its inception in 2008. The firm with 200 employees has delivered 5000+ next-generation information/operational security services/solutions successfully.
Kaspersky Book Prizes (in Digital Forensics, and Malware Analysis and Defence)
, the 34th representative division of Kaspersky Lab, a global cybersecurity company which has been operating in the market for over 27 years.

, a leading player that primarily engages in the marine, property and infrastructure businesses, through its subsidiaries which include Keppel Offshore & Marine, Keppel Infrastructure, Keppel Telecommunication & Transportation and Keppel Land.
(in Advanced Pastry, Contemporary Restaurant Cooking, Culinary Fundamentals, Marketing Communications in the Digital World, and Web Systems and Technologies) are made possible by

, Chief Executive Officer and Founder of EPS Computer Systems Pte Ltd, who wishes to encourage the pursuit of excellence among students of the culinary arts, marketing communication and Web technologies.
Kimly Construction Best Final Year Student Award in Civil Engineering
, one of the most progressive construction companies in Singapore that has been delivering quality landmark projects since 1965.
Kitchen Haus Group Book Prize in Food Service Management

. With eight brands under its helm, Kitchen Haus Group offers a wide range of innovative solutions ranging from F&B catering, retail, ready-to-eat, patisserie & high tech urban farming, powered by excellent service, sustainability and integrity.
KRISfam Fund Outstanding Student Award for Entrepreneurship & Innovation
is made possible with a gift from

, through the Community Foundation of Singapore, with the intent to support innovation and entrepreneurship while recognising academic excellence among students pursuing a full-time undergraduate degree programme under the Information Communications Technology Cluster.
CDL Millennium & Copthorne Book Prize in Hospitality Investment and Asset Management or Asset Management

. Mr Kwek is the Executive Chairman of Hong Leong Group Singapore. He is also Executive Chairman of CDL and Millennium & Copthorne Hotels Limited, and Chairman and Managing Director of Hong Leong Finance Limited.

CDL is a leading global real estate company with a network spanning 163 locations in 29 countries and regions. Listed on the Singapore Exchange, the Group is one of the largest companies by market capitalisation. Its income-stable and geographically-diverse portfolio comprises residences, offices, hotels, serviced apartments, student accommodation, retail malls and integrated developments.
Land Transport Authority Best Final Year Sustainable Infrastructure Engineering (Land) Student Award
. LTA is a statutory board under the Ministry of Transport, which spearheads land transport developments in Singapore.
Dr Lee Su Ann Book Prize in Sonography

to encourage radiography students to spark their interest in sonography and subsequently go on to become excellent sonographers. Dr Lee Su Ann trained as a radiologist in Singapore and started her career in a restructured hospital before moving on to private practice. She has been in clinical practice for more than 10 years and finds her work akin to a medical detective meaningful.
Lin Shumei Book Prize in Clinical Practice Education

, who wishes to encourage the pursuit of excellence in clinical practice among Occupational Therapy students. Dr Lin Shumei grew up from a humble family and started working during her holidays since secondary one. Education was made possible through many bursaries and scholarships. She suffered from ill health as a child and was in and out of hospitals frequently, and that triggered her interest in healthcare.

Dr Lin began her career as an occupational therapist in the hospital setting and later moved on to pursuing different areas such as education, research and leadership, while practicing clinical work. She believes in working hard and demonstrating the spirit of tenacity while placing faith in God. Instead of being grade-focused, she advocates for a holistic education where occupational therapy students can demonstrate the heart to serve, the humility to accept feedback and keep learning, and the drive to improve clinical practice.
Meiban Global Book Prize in Occupational Therapy and Chronic Disease Management with Older Adults
is made possible with a gift by

, an EMS (Electronics Manufacturing Service) provider with capabilities ranging from design and development, in-house mold making, plastic injection molding, PCB production and assembly to full product assembly. Meiban has more than 30 years of experience as one of Singapore’s top contract manufacturers based in Singapore, Malaysia and China.
Mitsubishi Electric Asia Book Prize in Mechanical Design

. Mitsubishi Electric Asia is a subsidiary of Mitsubishi Electric Corporation, a world-leading manufacturer of products ranging from home electronics, industrial and factory automation, semiconductors and devices, public utility systems, and defence and space systems. Established in Singapore in 1977, Mitsubishi Electric Asia has been providing reliable, high-quality products to homes, businesses and industries in Asia Pacific.
(in Acquired Cognitive-communication and Language Disorders, and Clinical Practice in Medical Imaging (Consolidation) or Clinical Practice Education 4) are made possible by

, the holding company of Singapore’s public healthcare clusters – National University Health System, National Healthcare Group and Singapore Health Services. Sharing the Ministry of Health’s vision to champion a healthy nation and ensure that people live well, live long and with peace of mind, their role is to enhance public healthcare sector performance by unlocking synergies and economies of scale.
Mount Alvernia Hospital Book Prize in Development in Nursing Practice
has been made possible with a gift from

, Singapore’s first private and only not-for-profit Catholic hospital.  The Hospital is committed to serve all with love, providing compassionate, excellent and holistic healthcare.  Today, it is a 304-bed general acute care hospital with tertiary medical capabilities, supported by over 1,200 accredited specialist doctors.
National Council of Social Service Outstanding Student Award in Occupational Therapy and Yearly Performance Awards
(for The Most Improved Student in Physiotherapy, and The Most Improved Student in Speech and Language Therapy) are made possible by the

. The mission of NCSS is to provide leadership and direction in enhancing the capabilities and capacity of its members, advocating for social service needs and strengthening strategic partnerships, for an effective social service ecosystem.
National Healthcare Group Outstanding Student Awards
(in Nursing, Physiotherapy, Occupational Therapy, Speech and Language Therapy) is made possible by

, a leader in public healthcare in Singapore recognised for delivering high-value patient care. NHG provides clinical services through an integrated system of primary care polyclinics, acute care tertiary hospitals, community hospitals, national speciality centres, and community-based ambulatory care centres. Together, NHG delivers comprehensive, holistic, and innovative healthcare to address the needs of its patients and the population it serves. As a learning organisation, it continues to establish itself as an academic health system to drive clinical excellence and raise research intensity.

As the Regional Health Manager for 1.5 million residents in Central and North Singapore, NHG collaborates with private general practices, and public and community health and social care providers to promote the health and well-being of its residents. With more than 20,000 healthcare professionals in NHG, it is committed to building healthier and more resilient communities and adding years of healthy life to the people it serves.
NING Research Book Prize in Mechanical Simulation
, Singapore’s leading finite element analysis and computational fluid dynamics consulting firm.
Oribel Book Prize in Occupational Justice and Disabilities Studies
is made possible with a gift by

. Oribel is a global lifestyle brand designing premium baby gears and development toys. Founded in 2014 and headquartered in Singapore, Oribel is known for its original, innovative and aesthetically beautiful products for the modern parents.
PKF Book Prize in Company Accounting

, a PKF International member firm – a network comprising over 480 offices in 150 countries, with over 20,000 partners and staff. The firm offers services that include assurance, taxation, corporate advisory and business solutions.
(in Strategic Management, and in Sustainable Hospitality Operation) is made possible by

, the owning company of The Fullerton Hotel Singapore. The magnificent Fullerton Building is a grand neoclassical landmark built in 1928. Gazetted in December 2015 as a National Monument, it was once home to Singapore's General Post Office, the Exchange, Chamber of Commerce, and the prestigious Singapore Club. For nearly a century, it played a pivotal role in Singapore's rich history.

Today, The Fullerton Hotel Singapore has been transformed into a stunning 400-room heritage hotel in Singapore. The Fullerton Hotel Singapore is carefully designed to provide both business and leisure travellers with a sanctuary of serenity and comfort in which to retreat and rejuvenate. Located in the heart of the financial and arts districts, the hotel blends rich heritage with contemporary style and personalised service to offer guests a world-class accommodation experience.
Quantum Inventions Book Prize in Database Systems

, which aims to provide innovative, sustainable and accessible data-driven intelligent mobility solutions for commuters and to help governments and enterprises transform the way that people, vehicles and goods move in smart cities.
Rohde & Schwarz Outstanding Student Award in Systems Engineering (ElectroMechanical Systems) or Mechatronics System

, the world’s leading manufacturer in wireless communications and EMC test and measurement equipment, as well as broadcasting and T&M equipment for digital terrestrial television. The electronics group is strategically based on five pillars: test and measurement, broadcast and media, cybersecurity, secure communications, radiomonitoring and radiolocation. The company addresses customers in the mobile radio, wireless, broadcasting, electronics and automotive industries, in aerospace and defence as well as government, security and critical infrastructures.
Rotary Club of Bugis Junction, Singapore
Rotary Club of Bugis Junction Commendation Award
Rotary Club of Bugis Junction Outstanding Student Award
Rotary Club of Bugis Junction, Singapore
. Chartered in 1996, the club’s primary focus is to provide service to community and encourage goodwill and peace.
Rotary Club of Jurong Town, Singapore
Rotary Club of Jurong Town Book Prize in Managing Long Term Conditions in Communities
Rotary Club of Jurong Town, Singapore
. Chartered in 1971 and the fourth Rotary Club in Singapore, the club’s primary focus is to provide humanitarian service and encourage goodwill and peace.
Samwoh Corporation Outstanding Student Award in Civil Engineering
, a market leader in construction and maintenance of road, aircraft and seaport pavement.

(in IWSP in Sustainable Infrastructure Engineering (Land), IWSP in Sustainable Infrastructure Engineering (Building Services), Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Power Engineering, Computer Engineering) is made possible by

. SBS Transit is a leading multi-modal public transport operator that is focused on delivering safe, reliable and pleasant journeys. Operating close to 200 bus routes with a fleet of over 3,300 buses, it is Singapore's largest and most established public bus operator. It also operates 83 kilometres of rail tracks over 79 stations including the North East Line, which is the world’s first fully automated, underground heavy metro system, the 42-km long Downtown Line, and the Sengkang-Punggol Light Rail Transit Systems. Every day, its network of buses and trains carries more than 3.5 million passenger trips. A publicly listed company, SBS Transit is a member of the ComfortDelGro Group, which is a leading global land transport company.
Seah Moon Ming Yearly Performance (Year 1) Award in Sustainable Infrastructure Engineering (Land) or Engineering Systems

. The Seah Moon Ming Foundation believes in kindness, humility and respect. The foundation aims to assist the less fortunate people who aspire to be better educated and well connected with the community.
Security Systems Association of Singapore Book Prize in Computer Networks

. Founded in 1995, the Security Systems Association of Singapore (SSAS) takes the lead in guiding and support the electronic security sector in Singapore in the provision of security products, solutions, and services. SSAS serves as a platform for its members to engage in dialogue, addressing issues that impact the security solutions industry. SSAS promotes collaboration with other associations on shared concerns and works towards the development of technical standards.
(in Digital Advertising, Branding, Campaigning, and Introduction to A La Carte Cooking) are made possible by
, who wishes to encourage the pursuit of excellence among students in the Digital Communications and Integrated Media field.
Siemens Book Prize in Systems and Software Engineering
, a global technology powerhouse focusing on electrification, automation and digitalization in the industry, energy, infrastructure and healthcare sectors.
Singapore Chemical Industry Book Prize in Process Safety

. The SCIC is the official body representing the interests of the chemical companies in Singapore in the private sector. Its member companies comprise of key multinationals and small & medium enterprises of chemical manufacturers as well as logistic services providers and traders.
Singapore Computer Society Prize for Final Year Best Capstone Project in Software Engineering

. Established in 1967, the Singapore Computer Society (SCS) is the leading infocomm and digital media professional society for industry professionals, leaders, students, and tech enthusiasts in Singapore. From publications to training and development, networking opportunities and more, SCS supports its members by fuelling their ambition to connect, collaborate and be inspired with innovation and excellence.

. The Singapore Concrete Institute was formed in July 1978. It is a non-profit organisation dedicated to advance concrete technology and its applications, foster collaboration with academia and industry partners, and share best practices.
Singapore Food Manufacturers' Association Book Prize in Industrial Systems Improvement

, a professional and active trade association formed in 1967 by a small group of like-minded local food manufacturers with the purpose of developing and promoting the local food manufacturing industry. With over 430 members, SFMA has evolved into the apex body for the food manufacturing industry of Singapore and is well-recognised and endorsed by Singapore governing bodies like EnterpriseSG and SPRING Singapore.
Singapore Green Building Council Outstanding Student Award in Sustainable Infrastructure Engineering (Building Services)

. Established in 2009, SGBC enables sustainability across the building and construction value chain, championing capability development and innovative solutions that support industry transformation through Membership, Certification and outreach programmes. The repository of proven green building solutions helps to enable green procurement in the industry, profiling leading and innovative solutions that go towards building a greener, healthier built environment. Together with a growing pool of industry-recognised Green Mark Accredited Professionals, SGBC addresses every touchpoint of the green building ecosystem.
Singapore Hotel Association Book Prize in Hospitality Data Analytics or Applied Data Analytics
. The Singapore Hotel Association is the apex body for hotels in Singapore. Its membership is made up of hotel entities which are represented by proprietors of hotels or appointed representatives.
Singapore Nurses Association Book Prize in Honour Thesis

. The Association’s mission is to raise the profile of nursing in Singapore, facilitate and support the contributions of nurses to improve and enhance the health of the population, with the objective of working towards recognising and enhancing the professional contributions of Nurses.
Singapore Society of Radiographers Book Prizes
(in Honours Thesis for Diagnostic Radiography, and Honours Thesis for Radiation Therapy) are made possible by

, a professional body representing Radiographers and Radiation Therapists in Singapore. The SSR also represents radiographers and radiation therapists within various committees that work with the Ministry of Health, Allied Health Professions Council, the Singapore Accreditation Council and Board of Examiners for Qualifying Examinations. SSR is affiliated with the International Society of Radiographers and Radiological Technologists (ISRRT) and the Australian Institute of Radiography.
SMRT Outstanding Student Award in Sustainable Infrastructure Engineering (Land)

, Singapore’s premier multi-modal land transport provider. SMRT Corp’s core businesses are in rail operations, maintenance and engineering as well as in bus, taxi and automotive services. Complementing these are its integrated businesses in retail, media and marketing, as well as properties and retail management. They are committed to sustainable development and corporate social responsibility.
SP Group Book Prize in Generation, Transmission and Distribution or SP Group Book Prize Transmission and Distribution

. SP is a leading utilities group in the Asia Pacific, empowering the future of energy with low-carbon, smart energy solutions for its customers. It owns and operates electricity and gas transmission and distribution businesses in Singapore and Australia, and sustainable energy solutions in Singapore, China, Vietnam and Thailand.
Sport Singapore (SportSG) Book Prize in Enhancing Human Performance by Exercise

, a statutory board of the Ministry of Culture, Community and Youth. As the national sport agency, its core purpose is to inspire the Singapore spirit and transform Singapore through innovative, fun and meaningful sporting experiences, while serving communities with passion and pride.
Sprinkler Fire Systems Book Prize in Fire Engineering Fundamentals
. With more than 42 years of experience in fire engineering, Sprinkler Fire Systems is one of the leading fire protection companies in Singapore.
Steelaris Book Prize in Design of Steel and Composite Structures

, a Singapore-based steel supply and project management firm with over 1,500 customers worldwide. Steelaris has a strong network of steel mills, traders, stockists, fabricators and engineering consultants to meet any project requirement.
(in Community & Public Health Nutrition, Contemporary Occupational Therapy Practice with Older Adults, and Physiotherapy Across Lifespan (Older Adults)) are made possible by

. St Luke’s ElderCare serves elders in the community via an integrated suite of services and programmes provided at its nursing home in Ang Mo Kio, 23 eldercare centres islandwide and an Active Aging Hub in Bishan.
(for Computing Science, Information Security and Software Engineering) are made possible by

, a Singapore-headquartered strategic investor specialising in Communications & Media, Data Centres and Infrastructure Technology businesses globally. It is represented in 15 countries, 3 continents across Asia Pacific, the US and Europe. Its vision is to build leading digital services and infrastructure platforms and create Asia-Pacific champions that facilitate business growth and help societies advance. As an active investor committed to sustainable, long-term value creation, it is driven to Ignite Enduring Change that unlocks potential and creates lasting value for all its stake holders. Its key portfolio companies include StarHub, TeleChoice, U Mobile, STT Global Data Centres Group, STT Cloud Group (Cloud Comrade, Cloud Cover and Quantum Security). 2nd Watch and Armor Cloud Security.

ST Telemedia is passionate about encouraging young people to raise their aspirations and achieve their full potential. This outstanding award adds to its longstanding history of supporting education initiatives and programmes.
TAK Outstanding Student Award in Dietetics and Nutrition
is made possible with a gift by

. Established in 1989, TAK is a driving force in the region’s lifestyle surfaces industry. The company’s key brand, Lamitak, which it wholly owns, is highly regarded by industry players and homeowners, with its wide choice of high quality, high-pressure laminates. TAK is headquartered in Singapore and it has regional offices in Malaysia, Indonesia, China, Hong Kong and Thailand and works with appointed distributors to offer Lamitak internationally from Australia, Taiwan, Korea and more.
Talentsis Book Prize in Managing Human Resources

, a new-age talent acquisition and staffing service company, aiming to be a one-stop service providing a full spectrum of innovative, cost-effective and value-added HR related services to their clients.
Tan and Neo Book Prize in Leadership and Management in Occupational Therapy
, who hope to inspire the next generation of students to serve as occupational therapist.
Taylor & Francis Asia Pacific Book Prize in Exercise Physiology

. For more than two centuries Taylor & Francis has been committed to the highest quality scholarly publishing, and this remains their goal today. Their purpose is to foster human progress through knowledge. They aim to promote a positive future for everyone through their work. Taylor & Francis imprints include Taylor & Francis, Routledge, CRC Press, F1000 Research, Dovepress and PeerJ.
(in Computer Networks, and Integrative Teams Project) are made possible by

. Operating in over 10 countries in the Asia Pacific region, Terra Systems is an end-to-end communications solutions provider that also offers branding and marketing services to its clients. It has helped corporate clients design, build, manage and optimize their communications to enhance business communications, operations, branding, marketing, improve their staff productivity and significantly increase profitability with improved customer satisfaction.
The Estate of Chong Yook Yin
Chong Yook Yin Book Prize in Principles and Practice of Population Health
The Estate of Chong Yook Yin

. Throughout her career as a nurse for over 20 years, Mdm Chong Yook Yin cared for countless patients, and would always amaze family and friends with her boundless enthusiasm for helping others through the medical profession. This Book Prize was established to honour Mdm Chong’s strong belief in education, and her wish to support students pursuing a similar, joyful calling in nursing.
Ngee Ann Kongsi Gold Medal (For the Most Outstanding Graduating Student)
. A non-profit body, it funds educational and other charitable projects with revenue generated from its ventures such as the landmark Ngee Ann City shopping and office complex on Orchard Road.
VMware Tanzu Awards (for Cloud and Distributed Computing, and Professional Software Development and Team Project 2)
. VMware is a leading provider of multi-cloud services for all apps, enabling digital innovation with enterprise control.
WSP Book Prize in Electromagnetic Fields and Waves
is made possible with a gift from

. As one of the world’s leading professional services firms, WSP exists to future-proof cities and the environment. WSP provides strategic advisory, engineering, and design services to its clients in Transport & Infrastructure, Property & Buildings, Earth & Environment, Mining & Energy, Water and Industry sectors. With the common purpose of creating positive, long-lasting impacts on the communities, it serves through a culture of innovation, integrity and inclusion.
X Inc Book Prizes (in Introduction to Collaborative Digital Media Production and Foodservice Management)

, the parent of a group of companies that has been in the food business since the 1930s. Covering businesses from food service and retail to logistics and property, X-Inc is propelled by its purpose of bringing dreams to life. It is a transformational leader that builds connections across the entire food industry to help all fulfil their aspirations and dreams.
YP Academy Book Prize in Business Information Technology
. YP Academy provides high quality programmes designed and taught by industry experts to equip practitioners with value-added skills and competencies.
Collection of Admission Card and Academic Dress

article_texts:
Our Donors
Our deepest appreciation to our donors for their generous support of SIT's students and mission.
In Appreciation of Our Donors
Alteryx Singapore Pte Ltd
Amazon Web Services Singapore Pte Ltd
AsiaCloud Solutions Pte Ltd
Association of Consulting Engineers Singapore
Baker Tilly
Blu5 Group
Bureau Veritas Marine Singapore Pte Ltd
Canon Medical Systems Asia Pte. Ltd.
Centre for Strategic Infocomm Technologies (CSIT)
Changi Airport Group
Choo Chiau Beng

Dr Lee Su Ann
The
Dr Lee Su Ann Book Prize in Sonography
is made possible by
Dr Lee Su Ann
to encourage radiography students to spark their interest in sonography and subsequently go on to become excellent sonographers. chevron--up
Dr Lin Shumei
The
Lin Shumei Book Prize in Clinical Practice Education
is made possible by
Dr Lin Shumei
, who wishes to encourage the pursuit of excellence in clinical practice among Occupational Therapy students. Dr Lin Shumei grew up from a humble family and started working during her holidays since secondary one. Education was made possible through many bursaries and scholarships. She suffered from ill health as a child and was in and out of hospitals frequently, and that triggered her interest in healthcare.
Dr Lin began her career as an occupational therapist in the hospital setting and later moved on to pursuing different areas such as education, research and leadership, while practicing clinical work. She believes in working hard and demonstrating the spirit of tenacity while placing faith in God. Instead of being grade-focused, she advocates for a holistic education where occupational therapy students can demonstrate the heart to serve, the humility to accept feedback and keep learning, and the drive to improve clinical practice.

, a leader in public healthcare in Singapore recognised for delivering high-value patient care. Precious Treasure Pte Ltd
, the owning company of The Fullerton Hotel Singapore. The magnificent Fullerton Building is a grand neoclassical landmark built in 1928. Gazetted in December 2015 as a National Monument, it was once home to Singapore's General Post Office, the Exchange, Chamber of Commerce, and the prestigious Singapore Club. For nearly a century, it played a pivotal role in Singapore's rich history.
Today, The Fullerton Hotel Singapore has been transformed into a stunning 400-room heritage hotel in Singapore. The Fullerton Hotel Singapore is carefully designed to provide both business and leisure travellers with a sanctuary of serenity and comfort in which to retreat and rejuvenate. Located in the heart of the financial and arts districts, the hotel blends rich heritage with contemporary style and personalised service to offer guests a world-class accommodation experience.
